department.ch: 國際經營管理碩士學位學程
department.en: International Master of Business Administration program

goal.ch: The objective of this course is for students to appreciate and understand the elements, principles, and roles of human resource management in the organization. Theories and practices are equally emphasized in this class to give an adequate foundation to HRM. This course employs lectures and participative and case teaching method in which learning will be centered on class discussions about the key concepts of HRM and the analysis of cases concerning the topics covered. Presentations, small group discussions, participation, and final exam are required.

outline.ch:
1 (9/12)Class Introduction
2 (9/19)Introduction to Human Resource Management and Strategic HRM
Suggested reading: Malik, A., Budhwar, P., ＆ Srikanth, N. R. (2020). McDonnell, A., Carbery, R., Burgess, J., ＆ Sherman, U. (2023). Technologically mediated human resource management in the gig economy. The International Journal of Human Resource Management, 32(19) 3995–4015.
3 (9/26)Case 1: Shree Ramkrishna Exports:Quadruple Bottom Line Approach to HRM
4 (10/3)The Legal Environment; Job Analysis and Design
Suggested reading: Clement, T., Ingham, G., ＆ Willems, J. (2022). Demerouti, E., ＆ Bakker, A. B. (2023). Job demands-resources theory in times of crises: New propositions. Organizational Psychology Review, 13(3), 209-236.
5 (10/10)National Day (No Class)
6 (10/17)HR Planning and Recruitment; Selection and Placement
Suggested reading: Horodyski, P. (2023). Applicants‘ perception of artificial intelligence in the recruitment process. Computers in Human Behavior Reports, 11, 100303.
7 (10/24)Case 2: Recruitment of a Star
8 (10/31)Training; Performance Management
Suggested reading: Fernandes, C., Veiga, P. M., Lobo, C. A., ＆ Raposo, M. (2023). Global talent management during the COVID‐19 pandemic? The Gods must be crazy!. Thunderbird International Business Review, 65(1), 9-19.
9 (11/7)Case 3: Performance Management at Vitality Health Enterprises, Inc.
10 (11/14)Employee Development; Employee Separation and Retention
Suggested reading: Jamal, M. T., Anwar, I., Khan, N. A., ＆ Ahmad, G. (2024). How do teleworkers escape burnout? A moderated-mediation model of the job demands and turnover intention. International Journal of Manpower, 45(1), 169-199.
11 (11/21)Sports Day (No Class)
12 (11/28)Pay Structure Decisions and Recognizing Employee Contributions with Pay
13 (12/5)Employee Benefits
Suggested reading: Jolly, P. M., McDowell, C., Dawson, M., ＆ Abbott, J. (2021). Pay and benefit satisfaction, perceived organizational support, and turnover intentions: The moderating role of job variety. International Journal of Hospitality Management, 95, 102921.
14 (12/12)Case 4: Name Your Price: Compensation Negotiation at Whole Health Management
15 (12/19)Collective Bargaining; Managing HR Globally
Suggested reading: Horak, S., ＆ Paik, Y. (2023). Informal network context: deepening the knowledge and extending the boundaries of social network research in international human resource management. The International Journal of Human Resource Management, 34(12), 2367-2403.
16 (12/26)Final Exam
